Berlin, Prussia.historical_context: In 1744, Berlin was a major cultural and scientific center in Prussia, serving as the location of the Imperial Academy of Sciences and Arts.

Saint Petersburg, Russia.historical_context: In 1727, St. Peterburg was a relatively new city, founded by Peter the Great in 1703 and still under construction.

Paris.historical_context: In 1785, Paris was a major city in the Kingdom of France, with the École Militaire located near the Luxembourg Gardens.
